alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:57AM CDT until May 09 at 1:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Kansas... Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County. For the Spring River Basin...including Baxter Springs, Waco, Carthage...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River above Baxter Springs. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Baxter Springs High School Track and Field Area. At 21.5 feet, Flood waters begin to cover Old Highway 66 at 1st Bridge or south of Rainbow Bridge. At 22.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Flood waters are one foot in depth across the Baxter Springs High School Track and Field Area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 AM CDT Friday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:46 - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - This will be the fourth highest crest on record. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on or before Saturday morning at 900 AM CDT.
